Need help reading this?

JsonStorage

This class allows you to save, load, delete, and rename JSON files. The files are stored in the file system.

In the following cases, it will throw an error:

  • invalid dirname
  • invalid filename
  • dir not exists
  • file not exists
  • blocked dirs or files
  • wrong permissions of dirs or files
  • and other unknown cases ...

Use for the error handling try-catch and check with exists() function additionally if a dir or file exists.

new JsonStorage(dir: String, options: Object)
Parameters
dir (String) Path to the storage directory
options (Object) Options. Default { spaces: 2, EOL: require('os').EOL, git: false }
Example
const JsonStorage = require(`@geofreak/json-storage`);

// init store
const store = new JsonStorage(`./storage`);

// init store with minify and git support
// const store = new JsonStorage(`${__dirname}/storage`, {spaces: 0, EOL: `` , git: true});

// sync error handling
try {
  // check if file exists
  if(store.existsSync(`users`, `user001`)){
    let json = store.getSync(`users`, `user001`);
    console.log(json);
  }
} catch (err) {
  console.error(err);
}

// async error handling
(async () => {
  try {
    // check if file exists
    if(await store.exists(`users`, `user001`)){
      let json = await store.get(`users`, `user001`);
      console.log(json);
    }
  } catch (err) {
    console.error(err);
  }
})();
Static Members
▸ read(file)

Reads a json file async.

read(file: string)
Parameters
file (string) Path of json file
Example
(async () => {

  // read json async
  console.log(await JsonStorage.read(`data.json`));

})();
▸ readSync(file)

Reads a json file sync.

readSync(file: string)
Parameters
file (string) Path of json file
Example
// read json sync
console.log(JsonStorage.readSync(`data.json`));
▸ write(file, json, options)

Writes a json file async.

write(file: string, json: object, options: object)
Parameters
file (string) Path of json file
json (object) Content of json file
options (object)
Example
// json
const json = {
  user001: {
    name: `Tom`
  }
};

(async () => {

  // write json async
  await JsonStorage.write(`data.json`, json);

})();
▸ writeSync(file, json, options)

Writes a json file sync.

writeSync(file: string, json: object, options: object)
Parameters
file (string) Path of json file
json (object) Content of json file
options (object)
Example
// json
const json = {
  user001: {
    name: `Tom`
  }
};

// write json sync
JsonStorage.writeSync(`${__dirname}/writeSync.json`, json);
Instance Members
▸ getAll(dir?)

Returns the complete storage or a complete directory as object.

getAll(dir: string?): object
Parameters
dir (string?) Dirname
Returns
object: Complete storage or directory (see example)
Example
(async () => {
  // get the whole storage
  const obj = await store.getAll();
  console.log(obj);
  // {
  //   "dir1": {
  //     "file1": {
  //       "content:": "dir1 file1"
  //     },
  //     "file2": {
  //       "content:": "dir1 file 2"
  //     }
  //   },
  //   "dir2": {
  //     "file1": {
  //       "content:": "dir2 file1"
  //     },
  //     "file2": {
  //       "content:": "dir2 file 2"
  //     }
  //   }
  // }

  // get a whole dir
  const dir1 = await store.getAll(`dir1`);
  console.log(dir1);
  // {
  //   "file1": {
  //     "content:": "dir1 file1"
  //   },
  //   "file2": {
  //     "content:": "dir1 file 2"
  //   }
  // }
})();
▸ getAllSync(dir?)

Returns the complete storage or a complete directory as object.

getAllSync(dir: string?): object
Parameters
dir (string?) Dirname
Returns
object: Complete storage or directory (see example)
Example
// get the whole storage
const obj = store.getAllSync();
console.log(obj);
// {
//   "dir1": {
//     "file1": {
//       "content:": "dir1 file1"
//     },
//     "file2": {
//       "content:": "dir1 file 2"
//     }
//   },
//   "dir2": {
//     "file1": {
//       "content:": "dir2 file1"
//     },
//     "file2": {
//       "content:": "dir2 file 2"
//     }
//   }
// }

// get a whole dir
const dir1 = store.getAllSync(`dir1`);
console.log(dir1);
// {
//   "file1": {
//     "content:": "dir1 file1"
//   },
//   "file2": {
//     "content:": "dir1 file 2"
//   }
// }
▸ get(dir?, file?)

Returns the JSON file as object or all filenames of a dir or all dirnames of the storage.

get(dir: string?, file: string?): Promise
Parameters
dir (string?) Dirname
file (string?) Filename
Returns
Promise: JSON file as object ( dir and file is set). Array of filenames ( dir is set only). Array of dirnames ( dir and file are not set).
Example
(async () => {
  // get file
  const json = await store.get(`users`, `user001`);
  console.log(json); // => { name: `Thomas` }

  // get all filenames of a directory
  const filenames = await store.get(`users`);
  console.log(filenames); // => [`user001`, `user002`, `user003`]

  // get all dirnames
  const dirnames = await store.get();
  console.log(dirnames); // => [`users`, `cars`]
})();
▸ getSync(dir?, file?)

Returns the JSON file as object or all filenames of a dir or all dirnames of the storage.

getSync(dir: string?, file: string?): (object | array)
Parameters
dir (string?) Dirname
file (string?) Filename
Returns
(object | array): JSON file as object ( dir and file is set). Array of filenames ( dir is set only). Array of dirnames ( dir and file are not set).
Example
// get file
let json = store.getSync(`users`, `user001`);
console.log(json); // => { name: `Thomas` }

// get all filenames of a directory
let filenames = store.getSync(`users`);
console.log(filenames); // => [`user001`, `user002`, `user003`]

// get all dirnames
let dirnames = store.getSync();
console.log(dirnames); // => [`users`, `cars`]
▸ setAll(dirOrJson, json?)

Sets a complete storage or dir (async).

setAll(dirOrJson: (string | object), json: object?)
Parameters
dirOrJson ((string | object)) Dirname or json (see example)
json (object?) Json (see example)
Example
const backupStorage = {
  "cars": {
    "car001": {
      "name": "Volkswagen"
    },
    "car002": {
      "name": "Mercedes"
    }
  },
  "users": {
    "user001": {
      "name": "Jens"
    },
    "user002": {
      "name": "Julia"
    }
  }
};

const backupDir = {
  "cat001": {
    "name": "Henry"
  },
  "cat002": {
    "name": "Hulk"
  }
};

(async () => {
  // set a complete storage
  await store.setAllSync(backupStorage);

  // set a complete dir
  await store.setAllSync(`cats`, backupDir);
})();
▸ setAllSync(dirOrJson, json?)

Sets a complete storage or dir (sync).

setAllSync(dirOrJson: (string | object), json: object?)
Parameters
dirOrJson ((string | object)) Dirname or json (see example)
json (object?) Json (see example)
Example
const backupStorage = {
  "cars": {
    "car001": {
      "name": "Volkswagen"
    },
    "car002": {
      "name": "Mercedes"
    }
  },
  "users": {
    "user001": {
      "name": "Jens"
    },
    "user002": {
      "name": "Julia"
    }
  }
};

const backupDir = {
  "cat001": {
    "name": "Henry"
  },
  "cat002": {
    "name": "Hulk"
  }
};

// set a complete storage
store.setAllSync(backupStorage);

// set a complete dir
store.setAllSync(`cats`, backupDir);
▸ set(dir, file, json)

Sets a JSON object.

set(dir: string, file: string, json: object): Promise
Parameters
dir (string) Dirname
file (string) Filename
json (object) JSON object
Returns
Promise:
Example
(async () => {
  // set a directory
  await store.set(`users`);

  // set a json 
  // (In this case, the directory will be automatically generated if it does not exist.)
  await store.set(`users`, `user001`, { name: `Thomas` });
})();
▸ setSync(dir, file, json)

Sets a JSON object.

setSync(dir: string, file: string, json: object)
Parameters
dir (string) Dirname
file (string) Filename
json (object) JSON object
Example
// set a directory
store.setSync(`users`);

// set a json 
// (In this case, the directory will be automatically generated if it does not exist.)
store.setSync(`users`, `user001`, { name: `Thomas` });
▸ remove(dir, file?)

Removes file if dir and file are set. Removes dir if dir is set only.

remove(dir: string, file: string?): Promise
Parameters
dir (string) Dirname
file (string?) Filename
Returns
Promise:
Example
(async () => {
  // remove directory
  await store.remove(`cars`);

  // remove file
  await store.remove(`users`, `user003`);
})();
▸ removeSync(dir, file?)

Removes file if dir and file are set. Removes dir if dir is set only.

removeSync(dir: string, file: string?)
Parameters
dir (string) Dirname
file (string?) Filename
Example
// remove directory
store.removeSync(`cars`);

// remove file
store.removeSync(`users`, `user003`);
▸ forEach(dir, callback, filter)

Iterates over files of a dir.

forEach(dir: string, callback: function, filter: function): Promise
Parameters
dir (string) Dirname
callback (function) Callback function like function(json, file){}
filter (function) Filter function like function(json, file){ // return true or false;}
Returns
Promise:
Example
(async () => {
  // iterate over all files
  await store.forEach(`users`, (json, file) => {
    console.log(file +`: ` + json);
  });
  // => user002: { name: `Julia` }
  // => user999: { name: `Thomas` }

  // iterate over filtered files
  // define a filter
  function filter(json, file) {
    if (json.name.startsWith(`T`)){
      return true;
    } else {
      return false;
    }
  }
  // iterate
  await store.forEach(`users`, (json, file) => {
    console.log(file +`: ` + json);
  }, filter);
  // => user999: { name: `Thomas` }
})();
▸ forEachSync(dir, callback, filter)

Iterates over files of a dir.

forEachSync(dir: string, callback: function, filter: function)
Parameters
dir (string) Dirname
callback (function) Callback function like function(json, file){}
filter (function) Filter function like function(json, file){ // return true or false;}
Example
// iterate over all files
store.forEachSync(`users`, (json, file) => {
  console.log(file +`: ` + json);
});
// => user002: { name: `Julia` }
// => user999: { name: `Thomas` }


// iterate over filtered files
// define a filter
function filter(json, file) {
  if (json.name.startsWith(`T`)){
    return true;
  } else {
    return false;
  }
}
// iterate
store.forEachSync(`users`, (json, file) => {
  console.log(file +`: ` + json);
}, filter);
// => user999: { name: `Thomas` }
▸ rename(dir, srcOrDest, dest?)

Renames a file or a dir

rename(dir: string, srcOrDest: string, dest: string?): Promise
Parameters
dir (string) Dirname
srcOrDest (string) Current filename or new dirname
dest (string?) New filename
Returns
Promise:
Example
(async () => {
  // rename a file
  await store.rename(`users`, `user001`, `user999`);

  // rename a dir
  await store.rename(`cars`, `my_cars`);
})();
▸ renameSync(dir, srcOrDest, dest?)

Renames a file or a dir

renameSync(dir: string, srcOrDest: string, dest: string?)
Parameters
dir (string) Dirname
srcOrDest (string) Current filename or new dirname
dest (string?) New filename
Example
// rename a file
store.renameSync(`users`, `user001`, `user999`);

// rename a dir
store.renameSync(`cars`, `my_cars`);
▸ empty(dir?)

Empty the storage or a dir. If a directory is set, it will be emptied. If no directory is set, the storage will be emptied.

empty(dir: string?): Promise
Parameters
dir (string?) Dirname.
Returns
Promise:
Example
(async () => {
  // empty the storage
  await store.empty();

  // empty a dir
  await store.empty(`users`);
})();
▸ emptySync(dir?)

Empty the storage or a dir. If a directory is set, it will be emptied. If no directory is set, the storage will be emptied.

emptySync(dir: string?)
Parameters
dir (string?) Dirname.
Example
// empty the storage
store.emptySync();

// empty a dir
store.emptySync(`users`);
▸ exists(dir?, file?)

Checks if a directory or a file exists. Checks file if dir and file are set. Checks dir if dir is set only.

exists(dir: string?, file: string?): Promise
Parameters
dir (string?) Dirname.
file (string?) Filename
Returns
Promise: Returns true if the dir or file exists, false otherwise.
Example
(async () => {
  // check dir
  await store.exists(`users`); // => true

  // check file
  await store.exists(`users`, `tom`); // => false
})();
▸ existsSync(dir, file?)

Checks if a directory or a file exists. Checks file if dir and file are set. Checks dir if dir is set only.

existsSync(dir: string, file: string?): boolean
Parameters
dir (string) Dirname
file (string?) Filename
Returns
boolean: Returns true if the dir or file exists, false otherwise.
Example
// check dir
store.existsSync(`users`); // => true

// check file
store.existsSync(`users`, `tom`); // => false

HELPER

GitRepository

This class executes git commands.

new GitRepository(dir: string)
Parameters
dir (string) Directory of the git repository
Instance Members
▸ add(path)

Executes a git add asynchronous.

add(path: String)
Parameters
path (String) Path of dir or file
Example
(async () => {
  await git.add(`"/home/user1/storage/cars/car001.json"`);
})();
▸ addSync(path)

Executes a git add synchronous.

addSync(path: String)
Parameters
path (String) Path of dir or file
Example
git.addSync(`"/home/user1/storage/cars/car001.json"`);
▸ commit(path, message)

Executes a git commit asynchronous.

commit(path: String, message: String)
Parameters
path (String) Path of dir or file
message (String) Commit message
Example
(async () => {
  await git.commit(`"/home/user1/storage/cars/car001.json"`, `Changed name of car001.`);
})();
▸ commitSync(path, message)

Executes a git commit synchronous.

commitSync(path: String, message: String)
Parameters
path (String) Path of dir or file
message (String) Commit message
Example
git.commitSync(`"/home/user1/storage/cars/car001.json"`, `Changed name of car001.`);

checkDirname

Checks if the dirname is valid. If the dirname is not valid, this function will throw an error.

checkDirname(dir: string)
Parameters
dir (string) Dirname

checkFilename

Checks if the filename is valid. If the filename is not valid, this function will throw an error.

checkFilename(file: string)
Parameters
file (string) Filename

checkNames

Checks if the filename and the dirname are valid. If the filename or the dirname are not valid, this function will throw an error.

checkNames(dir: string, file: string)
Parameters
dir (string) Dirname
file (string) Filename

isNameValid

Checks if a filename or dirname is valid.

isNameValid(name: string): boolean
Parameters
name (string) Name to be checked
Returns
boolean: True: Name is valid. False: Name is not valid.
